My last one was a new 1990 Honda 350, which did everything I wanted, survived a terrible beating and three years later brought $700 less than I had paid for it. 
 
 Over the past three months I've done a lot of research on new ones, including lurking at several ATV forums, and am of the opinion that Honda has dropped behind the technical development curve over the last ten-years. That research has also shown people favor what ever brand they own, much like Ford/Chevy loyalty among vehicle owners, so owner reviews have been informative only to the point of experienced negatives. 
 
 I believe several people on the forum, from limited lifestyle descriptions, own them, and thought I'd see if there were any opinions here on my choice of a new ATV. This will primarily be a utility machine; logging, hunting, forest roaming and a few times a year exploring beach dunes. Based on ATV magazine field testing comparisons, forums and specs, I've decided on a Suzuki King Quad. 
 
 Comments appreciated.

Honda definitely has not kept up. A friend of mine owns one and says he wanted to put a trailer hitch on, but the dealership wouldn't do it, saying the transmission wouldn't hold up.
